STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 30, 2023
Sarah Codere
U.P. KIDS
57 HURON ST,
HOUGHTON, MI, 49931-2167
Re: License #: CB310282171
Dear Ms. Codere:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
Agyst 28, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, Area Manager, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION

Licensee Group Organization: Good Will Farm Association Inc dba U.P. Kids
Licensee Designee: Sarah Codere
Chief Administrator: Sarah Codere
Name of Agency: U.P. KIDS
Agency Address: 57 HURON ST
HOUGHTON, MI 49931-2167
Agency Telephone #: 9064820520
Original Issuance Date: 03/21/2006
Service Types: Place children for adoption, Certify foster
homes for license, Supervise Independent
Living, Place children in foster home,
Evaluate Applicants for adoption
1

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CPA Rule 400.12311 Foster parent/agency agreement
(3) An agency shall document review of the foster
parent/agency agreement with the foster family at
least annually and, when needed, develop a new
agreement.
Three foster home files were reviewed. Two of three files did not have updated
foster/parent agency agreements.
File # 1. In the file there was no agreement for the annual licensing period from
January 1, 2021, to December 31, 2022.
File # 2. In the file there was no agreement for the annual licensing period from
December 24, 2021 to December 31, 2022.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
08/18/22 Renewal, CAP approved 11/14/22.
CPA Rule 400.12312 Foster parent training
(2) The foster parent training plan shall provide for
all of the following:
2

(c) Not less than 6 hours of training annually for
each licensee after the time periods specified in
subdivision (b) of this subrule.
Three foster home files were reviewed. Two of three files did not have updated
annual training.
File # 1. In the file there was no documented training for the annual licinsing period
from January 1, 2021, to December 31, 2022.
File # 2. In the file there was no documented training for the annual licensing period
from December 24, 2021, to December 31, 2022.
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has
been given an application for renewal of the license
not less than 60 calendar days before the expiration
date of the license.
Three foster home files were reviewed. One of three documented that the renewal
application was sent on October 31, 2022, for a November 17, 2022, renewal.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the
home.
Four files and thirteen service plans were reviewed. One of 13 service plans was
late. The plan was due February 25, 2023, and was completed on March 6, 2023.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and parenting time
(1) An agency shall have a policy regarding visitation
and parenting time that contains, at a minimum, all of
the following:
(b) An agency social service worker shall visit the
foster child and the foster parent in the foster
parent’s home at least once every month.
3

Four files and thirteen service plans were reviewed. One of four files contained three
visitations that lacked narratives. The visits were dated June 6, 2023, June 15,
2023, and July 26, 2023.
CPA Rule 400.12708 Child evaluation
(1) A social service worker shall complete a written
assessment of each child available for adoption
within 60 days of the child being referred for
adoption. The assessment shall include all
information available in the foster care file from the
date the child entered care and shall meet all
requirements of section 27 of 1939 PA 288, MCL
710.27.
Three child evaluations were reviewed. One of three documented that the child was
referred for adoption on November 15, 2022, and the child evaluation was
completed on March 1, 2023.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
Initial Case Plan (ISP) - within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date. Note: This FTM may
be combined with the CPS Case Opening (ISP) FTM.
Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date. Permanent Ward
Service Plan (PWSP) - within 30 calendar days before
the case plan due date.
Four files and 13 FTM’s were reviewed. Four of four files contained one or more
missing FTM’s.
File #1. The file did not document that an FTM occurred for the service plan period
ending March 31, 2023.
File # 2. The file did not document an FTM for the service plan ending May 25,
2023.
File # 3. The file documented that an FTM was held however it was more that thirty
days from the service plan due date. The FTM was held June 21, 2023, for the
service plan due July 30, 203.
File # 4. The file did not document that an FTM occurred for the service plan period
ending July 18, 2023. This same file did not document that an FTM occurred for the
service plan ending April 19, 2023.
4

REPEAT VIOLATION:
08/18/22 Renewal, CAP approved 11/14/22.
FOM 801-03 Medical Passport
For children entering foster care, the initial medical
passport must be provided within two weeks of the
child's placement date to the following: • Foster care
provider. • Young adult voluntary foster care
(YAVFC) youth/young adult re-entering foster care.
The actual date the medical passport is provided
must be documented in the electronic case
management record.
Four files and thirteen medical passports were reviewed. One of thirteen
documented that the foster care provider received the passport late. The child was
placed on January 27, 2023, and the provider received the passport on May 2,
2023.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
08/18/22 Renewal, CAP approved 11/14/22.
FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable:
Caseworker. • Supervisor. • Second line supervisor,
when siblings in care are placed apart. • Parents who
are a member of a participating household. • Youth
ages 14 and older. • Foster parents, relative caregivers,
and unrelated court ordered caregivers.
Four files and thirteen service plans were reviewed. Three of thirteen service plans
did not document signatures on treatment plans.
File # 1. A PATP dated May 25, 2023, did not document foster parent and parent
signatures.
5

File # 2. A PATP dated January 31, 2023. did not document foster parent and
parent signatures.
File # 3. A PATP dated April 19, 2023, did not document foster parent and parent
signatures.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
08/18/22 Renewal, CAP approved 11/14/22.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Technical assistance was not provided at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period. The agency submitted a approved CAP on November 14, 2022,
in response to those violations established during the renewal audit completed on
August 18, 2022. The current interim inspection established four repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators assessment was reviewed and was found to be thorough
and addressed the agencies efforts to follow their CAP. The CAP also addressed
the procedure for any unplanned or disrupted placements.
Financial Overview
The agency submitted financial records including an annual budget and an annual
CPA audit. These documents were reviewed and the agency appears financially
viable.
Staff and Youth Interviews
6

Staff interviewed reported that they like working for the agency and feel supported
by their supervisors. Staff also reported that they feel they have a strong team
which works together and supports one another.
Youth were not interviewed by the consultant.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in downtown Houghton in a modern facility next to the
Portage canal. The office is spacious and well maintained.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified three safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They
are as follows.
SAFETY ALERT # 1. The safety alert was generated on May 23, 2023, as the home
did not have firearms trigger locked and secured. Ammunition was also not secured
and stored separately. On May 24, 2023, the agency purchased trigger locks for the
firearms and they were installed on the same day. The guns were relocated to a
room where they could be locked. Ammunition was also relocated and stored
securely and separately from the guns. Photos of the secured guns and ammunition
were uploaded.
SAFETY ALERT # 2. A safety alert was generated on May 25, 2023, as the home
did not have a smoke alarm in the basement. The agency ordered a smoke alarm
which was installed on June 6, 2023. and photos of the alarm were received.
SAFETY ALERT # 3. A safety alert was generated on June 6, 2023, as a bedroom
did not have a door. The agency opened a special evaluation. On June 6, 2023, the
bedroom door was reinstalled and photos provided.
VIII.
The CPA Analyst reported that families and children reported being satisfied with
services and they feel supported by the agency.
IX. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
August 31, 2023
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
